metadata.synopsis: The player's allies are gathered in a building before the High Hall combats to reach the Netherbrain. They have been warned that one of us might be an illithid. This dialogue carries that reactivity, followed by the 'and my axe' battle rally from all of our allies.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug book > Set Quest> Act 3 > Endgame > Master SetupRepeat the step aboveFollow follow all the steps up until choosing mindflayerEither go through the default options of go through manual setupChoose either Good or Evil AlliesProceed as normal

48.speaker: Withers
48.text: Thou art alone, but for thy friends. Didst thou not make allies?

111.speaker: Withers
111.text: I fear thy final confrontation will prove quite a challenge.

82.speaker: Withers
82.text: Hadst thou allies, the yoke of salvation may not have weighed down on thee so.

184.speaker: Withers
184.text: But, since thou didst not convince others to join thy cause, thou wilt face the Netherbrain's assault armed only with thine own faculties.

61.speaker: Withers
61.text: Let us hope they are enough, lest this plane fall to illithid ruin.

60.speaker: Withers
60.text: I wish thee good fortune, and good grace.

70.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
70.text: We have lost much already. And we will lose more before the day is out.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of party walking into the Gather Your Allies room, not yet noticed by the gathered crowd. Beorn is standing on a small platform, mid-motivating-speech, addressing the crowd.

179.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
179.text: You may not have expected to be here. You may not have wanted this fight.

53.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
53.text: The soldiers around you may not be friends. In fact, they may be strangers, antagonists, enemies.

110.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
110.text: But today, they are your allies. For today, we fight a greater evil than any of you have ever known. And we cannot fight it alone.

187.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
187.text: Though it may not be your city, though it may not be your cause, you must find it within you to fight side by side. For today -
187.context: CinematicNodeContext: Beorn spots us in the crowd mid-sentence.

51.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
51.text: But even when the last soul falls, Baldur's Gate will stand. For Baldur's Gate is more than just a city.

143.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
143.text: It is more than a place of opportunity for those of mercantile spirit, more than a place of refuge for those who are lost, more than a home for friends, loved ones, and adventuring souls...

0.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
0.text: Baldur's Gate is a place where anyone can find what they need - if they're just willing to fight for it.

183.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
183.text: Today - Baldur's Gate needs us. Today, we fight for -
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: Beorn spots us in the crowd mid-sentence.

56.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
56.text: This is the one you spoke of?
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to one of the allies.

160.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
160.text: The very same. The champion we've been waiting for.

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: The one who will save Baldur's Gate from ruin.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *The Fist eyes you with suspicion. He was not expecting the saviour of Baldur's Gate to be a mind flayer.*

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *The Fist examines your illithid ally with suspicion. He was not expecting the saviour of Baldur's Gate to be accompanied by a mind flayer.*

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *The Fist examines your illithid ally with suspicion. He was not expecting the saviour of Baldur's Gate to be accompanied by a mind flayer.*

31.speaker: Withers
31.text: Appearances may change, but they do not mask the one within. This one I know.

133.speaker: Withers
133.text: This mind flayer will fight with thee. It will save thy city and thy lives.

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *The Fist's suspicion softens to curiosity, his hostility melting at the recognition that there's more beyond those eyes than malice.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *The Fist eyes your illithid ally with suspicion, softening to curiosity. His hostility melting at the recognition that there's more beyond those eyes than malice.*

164.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: A beat while he considers the mind flayer. Flaming Fist salute before delivering the line - feet together and bring left hand to right pec - then return to normal stance after.

42.speaker: Arabella
42.text: Never thought I'd be fighting alongside a mind flayer! But I'll fight with you. With magic.

1.speaker: Arabella
1.text: You helped me, once. I figured it's time I paid you back. With magic.

119.speaker: Dammon
119.text: I'm better at crafting steel than wielding it - your friend here is armoured and potion-fuelled and ready for battle!
119.context: NodeContext: he's talking about the owlbear cub

79.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
79.text: I have marshalled the best the Flaming Fist has to offer. We will fight to the last.

150.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
150.text: My Ironhand Gnomes brought enough explosives to level the Upper City. Just show us where we're needed.

73.speaker: Barcus Wroot
73.text: You may have changed, but my debt to you still stands. The Ironhand Gnomes' firepower is yours to command. Just show us where it's needed.

23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
23.text: You've unexpected friends, but my debt to you still stands. The Ironhand Gnomes' firepower is yours to command. Just show us where it's needed.

93.text: Your safety is of paramount importance, citizen. My services are at your disposal.

172.speaker: Isobel
172.text: The Moonmaiden's silver light is a shield in dark times. Today, it is mine to wield.

131.speaker: Nightsong
131.text: The Moonmaiden's silver light can cut as sharp as any sword. I wield it this day.

81.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
81.text: Whatever strength I have to lend, I will lend it. I will make my city proud again.

83.speaker: Wyll
83.text: Our city, father. Today, I fight in your honour.

178.speaker: Mol
178.text: Did you think I was going to let you have all the fun? Mol looks out for her friends, mind flayers included, and she'll have your back. Trust me.

166.speaker: Mol
166.text: Did you think I was going to let you have all the fun? Mol looks out for her friends, and she'll have your back. Trust me.

58.speaker: Phasm
58.text: You carried me once, friend, and now I'll carry you. Ho-ho!

88.speaker: Yurgir
88.text: You can count on me, little squid. I thirst for the hunt.

5.speaker: Lorroakan
5.text: Ramazith's arcane artillery is more than ready to demolish your enemies and mine. Give the word, and you will not be disappointed.

43.speaker: Roah Moonglow
43.text: You've bought yourself some Zhentish steel. Use it well.

170.speaker: Valeria
170.text: I'm in the mood to crack some skulls after that fuckery in the Temple of Bhaal. The City Watch will be glad to oblige me.

122.speaker: Volo
122.text: Not sure what I have to offer a mind flayer, if I'm honest, but I hope my words of encouragement and reassurance will strengthen your - ah - resolve.

16.speaker: Zevlor
16.text: The journey has been brutal, but I stand here a Hellrider once more, and I would die a proud man if I died this day.
16.context: NodeContext: Not dramatic - stating a simple fact

37.speaker: Viconia DeVir
37.text: I have gathered Lady Shar's faithful. They wait in the shadows for your order.

75.speaker: Proselyte of Mahkloompah
75.text: The blood god asks tribute. The kuo-toa answer the call!

102.speaker: Auntie Ethel
102.text: Congratulations, petal - you've got a hag on your side. And if that doesn't save your arse, nothing can.

118.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
118.text: I want my city back, and I've brought the toughest bastards from the Guild to get the job done.

155.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
155.text: Your Father has sent me to your aid again, Chosen one. Together we will bring new glory to His name. I will bless you in the coming battles. Let us bathe the way in blood.

22.speaker: Unholy Assassin Mitchia
22.text: The Murder Lord's own tributes will be yours to command. Use us violently, and slaughter well.

116.speaker: Astarion
116.text: My dark forces are at your command today. We have a common goal.

154.speaker: Shadowheart
154.text: I was the first Dark Justiciar in a generation, but soon we'll be legion. And today, we fight at your side.

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: All the strength of the lands we healed flows through me. And from me, to you. No matter what form you take.

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: All the strength of the lands we healed flows through me. And from me, to you. And whatever company you keep.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: All the strength of the lands we healed flows through me. And from me, to you.

165.speaker: Mizora
165.text: I wouldn't miss this for all the souls in the city. Call my name, and I'll bring the hellfire.

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.context: NodeContext: Wry, slight mock bow - she's quoting a well-known line from previous games. Should be pitched to soften the drama of a string of characters pledging their loyalty to us before / after

3.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
3.text: Glad to have you with us, and not a moment too soon.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *The air is thick with anticipation. All eyes are on you.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *They're expecting a speech, something to stir their hearts and put fire in their bellies for the fight ahead.*

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *What will a mind flayer say that could encourage them on the threshold of battle?*

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Why speak at all? Infiltrate their minds, and stir whatever motivations you find within.

125.context: CinematicNodeContext: A mindmeld effect expands out from the player and ripples through the crowd, turning their consternation to cheer.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Our freedom depends on you. Fight with everything you have.

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *Uncertainy ripples through them. That a mind flayer could appeal to freedom is... a confusing notion.*

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Look to Wyll - the Grand Duke's words will surely inspire them.

173.speaker: Wyll
173.text: We fight for the survival of Baldur's Gate. And we will win.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: I cannot promise that this is the last time I will ask you to fight for your future, your lives, and your city. But I can promise you this.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: Whatever crisis we face, whatever danger threatens - your Grand Duke will always fight beside you. My blade is yours.

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: Now, let's kill ourselves a Netherbrain.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Look to Minsc - the Hero of Baldur's Gate.

100.speaker: Minsc
100.text: There was a time when my hamster counted every bootprint that I left behind me, whether it was in snow, mud, or evil's backside.

50.speaker: Minsc
50.text: Boo did this because he knows the heart of Minsc, and he knew that a part of it was all those many steps behind us. In Rashemen. At home.

112.speaker: Minsc
112.text: Minsc could never count as high as Boo, so the number of steps soon became too large for him to hold in his head. Too large and too sad.

114.speaker: Minsc
114.text: But now Minsc knows the number. The number is none, because Baldur's Gate is my home, and it will not fall while Minsc and Boo still stand.

180.speaker: Jaheira
180.text: You are still full of surprises, ranger. I could not have said it better.
180.context: NodeContext: slightly choked up by Minsc's speech

41.speaker: Jaheira
41.text: But now that it is said, it is time. Swords, not words. Butt-kicking for goodness.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Look to Jaheira - she'll know what the people wish to hear.

135.speaker: Jaheira
135.text: Many of you know my name, few of you know my face. This is as it should be.

8.speaker: Jaheira
8.text: I am not a hero, I am a servant. Of nature, of balance - of life. At this moment, I serve all of you.

123.speaker: Jaheira
123.text: I buried my husband, Khalid, a hundred years ago. That wound still bleeds.

90.speaker: Jaheira
90.text: While I draw breath, I will not let this city bleed.

77.speaker: Minsc
77.text: Boo is moved to tears at the beauty of these words, Jaheira.

129.context: CinematicNodeContext: An uncomfortable silence ripples through the gathered allies, but they nod along encouragingly nonetheless.

59.speaker: The Emperor
59.text: Not the roaring validation you were looking for? Don't worry - I'll convince them.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: A mindmeld effect expands out from the Emperor and ripples through the crowd, turning their consternation to cheer.

168.context: CinematicNodeContext: The allies cheer, emboldened and ready for battle. Preferably: shot from behind them looking at player to make them feel extra heroic.

13.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
13.text: We'll prepare ourselves - we'll be ready when you call upon us.

186.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
186.text: May your weapons sing through your enemy's throats.

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *You feel a tickle of mirth in the Emperor's thoughts. If they only knew the truth.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Embrace your courage and let it guide you through battle. Don't give in to fear!

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Our freedom depends on your bravery today. You are the guardians of the city!

54.speaker: Player
54.text: The outcome of this battle is not predetermined. It will depend on your will to win.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: We fight to defeat the Netherbrain. We fight to take control of its Crown.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: To blood, death, and slaughter! A fight well fought, and a brain well burned.

162.speaker: Ulma
162.text: My people have never hunted a monster this large - they are eager to join the fray.

157.speaker: Unholy Assassin Rycke
157.text: The Murder Lord's own tributes will be yours to command. Use us violently, and slaughter well.

153.speaker: Volo
153.text: I have no steel or spell to gift you, but I hope my words of encouragement and reassurance will strengthen your resolve.

182.speaker: Rolan
182.text: I made some improvements to Ramazith's arcane artillery. Give the word, and the sky falls on any who stand in your way.

145.speaker: Yurgir
145.text: You can count on me, little rabbit. And your squiddy friend. I thirst for the hunt.

91.speaker: Yurgir
91.text: You can count on me, little rabbit. I thirst for the hunt.

27.speaker: Barcus Wroot
27.text: The Ironhand Gnomes are forever in your debt. Our firepower is yours to command. Just show us where it's needed.

176.speaker: Narrator
176.text: *The Fist eyes your illithid ally with suspicion, softening to curiosity. His hostility melting at the recognition that there's more beyond those eyes than malice.*

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *The Fist eyes your illithid ally with suspicion, softening to curiosity. His hostility melting at the recognition that there's more beyond those eyes than malice.*

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *The Fist eyes your illithid ally with suspicion, softening to curiosity. His hostility melting at the recognition that there's more beyond those eyes than malice.*

117.speaker: Withers
117.text: Observe with whom it travelleth. Friends.

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *The Fist examines your illithid ally with suspicion. He was not expecting the saviour of Baldur's Gate to be accompanied by a mind flayer.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *The Fist examines your illithid ally with suspicion. He was not expecting the saviour of Baldur's Gate to be accompanied by a mind flayer.*

25.speaker: Beorn Wunterbrood
25.text: Well met. You are most welcome here.

21.speaker: Isobel
21.text: That is indeed the one who purged my home of a terrible evil - my father, Ketheric.

106.speaker: Isobel
106.text: There's no one I'd trust more to protect this city.

35.speaker: Nightsong
35.text: Aye - and forever will I sing the praise of the one who saved me from a century of horrors.

149.speaker: Nightsong
149.text: This hero and no other can save this city from destruction. Of this I am certain.

113.speaker: Withers
113.text: The very same. The one who comes to save the city.

96.speaker: Withers
96.text: They will lay the final stitch on the fate of Baldur's Gate.

64.speaker: Jaheira
64.text: I said only kind and flowery things - Harper's honour.
64.context: NodeContext: Wry, to player - another character has dramatically asked if we're the one Jaheria has told everyone about

80.speaker: Jaheira
80.text: Yes, this is the one - and just in time. There's a city to be saved.
80.context: NodeContext: Turning back to guard, confirming we're the one everyone's been waiting for

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: The very same. They saved something very precious to me from the grips of the shadow curse.

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: Now they stand poised to save the city. I can think of no champion more worthy.

92.speaker: Withers
92.text: Thou art alone. Didst thou not make allies?

146.speaker: Withers
146.text: Thou art not alone, but thy numbers are few.

45.speaker: Withers
45.text: Yet it could be argued that excellence outweighs multitude where battle is concerned.

138.speaker: Withers
138.text: Let us hope they are enough, lest this plane fall to illithid ruin.

74.speaker: Withers
74.text: I wish thee good fortune, and good grace.
